chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Omar Matyas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Matyas to 9 months jail, with Huber. The Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years. Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

miscConds.notes: --payment of costs, fees and surcharges, to include $718.27 in extradition fees

--no contact with Victim 1

--no presence at residence of Victim 1, where vehicle was taken from

--to undergo any assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent

--to comply with DNA sample provision

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 4:00pm 
Defendant Omar Matyas in court, in custody.  Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court for Omar Matyas.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified--DA Hall submit victim impact statement.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 
Statement made by Mr. Matyas

The Court sentences Mr. Matyas to 9 months jail, with Huber. The Court STAYS this sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1
--no presence at residence of Victim 1, where vehicle was taken from
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges, to include $718.27 in extradition fees

Days credit for time already served:  30  days

The Court directs Mr. Matyas to report to Probation by noon tomorrow. 

The Court directs the $100 bond previously ordered forfeit be reinstated and applied to financial obligations. 
recess: 4:24pm
Status conference on August 30, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
AMENDED BOND; $100.00 previously posted, therefore the posting of $400.00 Cash Bond is required for release on this Bond

[ml] Case called at 2;15PM
Defendant Omar Matyas appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD Att Rumpf remains appointed).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Att  that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Att De La Rosa provides an updated address for the Defendant: 1384 Division St #204, Delafield, WI 53234
Att De La Rosa provides an explanation for the Defendant's non-appearance.
The Court verifies that the Defendant knows how to view his case on CCAP.

The Court modifies bond, requiring a $500.00 Cash Bond ($100.00 already posted) with the same conditions as previously ordered.

recess 2:21PM

NEXT: Status Conference on 08/30 at 3:00PM with in person appearances
Extradition Forecast
Returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.

[MK] case called at 11:12am 
Defendant Omar Matyas does not appear. Attorney Amber Rumpf appears. DA Intern Haley Shelton appears for the State of Wisconsin under the supervision of ADA Theresa Beck.  
This case is scheduled for Status Conference today. Attorney Rumpf has no information regarding the non-appearance. 
The Court lifts the stay; the Warrant is to issue- it is returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.
The Court finds Bond to be in default.  
recess 11:13am

NEXT:  schedule Bail Forfeiture Hearing
Status conference on August 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[Court Reporter: Jane Swagel]
[ma] Case called at 10:33 AM 
Attorney Amber K. Rumpf appears.   Krysta Parson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Omar Matyas does NOT appear. 

The Court reviews the court record. 

Atty Rumpf indicates that she received communications from Mr. Matyas that he was unable to attend court due to transportation issues. 

ADA Parson requests warrant. 
The Court STAYS warrant until next court date. 

recess: 10:36am 
NEXT: Status on 8/4/22 at 11:00am
Pre-trial conference on June 22, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Status conference on June 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 8:50AM
Defendant Omar Matyas in court with attorney Amber K. Rumpf. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing, however the Defense files waiver documents prior to the case being called.
The Court proceeds with a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:

Mr. Matyas waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

recess 8:54AM

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 06/22 at 11:40AM with counsel appearances only    (2) Status Conference on 06/30 at 9:30AM with in person appearances

Defendant Omar Matyas appears in custody from the Jefferson County Jail. ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
